reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Well what can you say? What you've got here is a property in the center of Grand Teton National Park with amazing views of Jackson Lake. There is a gas station, a marina, a convenience store, a couple of restaurants, a nice gift shop, and a friendly staff. The problem is the rooms.
reviews.title: Everything's great...except the room!

likes.disliked: — Room is in great need of refurbishing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were in a Lower Lakefront Retreat, which has 2 queen beds in one room, a sleeper sofa in the living area, one bathroom and a small kitchen area. This provided ample room for my family of 2 adults and 3 small children. The problem is that the property is stuck in an early 70's funk. The bathroom is very small and the furniture is old and worn. For $236.00 per night I would have expected far better. After all, how much money could it really cost to provide a decent sofa sleeper rather than the old, tired thing they provide to their guests? How about throwing a box of tissues in the bathroom like every other hotel?
reviews.title: Amazing view and very quiet and comfortable although deck was smoky

likes.liked: — The amazing views, location in the park and the quiet and relaxed atmosphere
likes.disliked: — deck was smoky from downstairs neighbors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The problem here is that there is no true competition in the Park, so the operators have no incentive to invest in their properties. They can go on charging high rates for marginal rooms with no fear of a Holiday Inn Express or a Hampton Inn coming in and eating their lunch. It's good for them but bad for the consumer. Consider this: you could go to the South Rim of the Grand Canyon and stay in Tusayan, just outside of the Park entrance, and have better choices of accommodations and restaurants at far less cost than Signal Mountain Lodge. This is because there is a free market at work. When this dynamic is absent--as it is in Grand Teton National Park--it allow operators to exploit their stranglehold on the choices and the consumer pays the price.
reviews.title: Rustic and Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Disappointment with the room aside, I will say that the location does provide a good base for exploring the Tetons.
reviews.title: great stay at SML!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: We stayed at Signal Mountain Lodge for 4 nights following a tour of Yellowstone. We were thrilled with our accommodations and would not hesitate to return, despite an odd smoking situation (which seemed to be a fluke).
reviews.title: It's like living in a postcard

likes.disliked: — Lack of attention to details like decent sheets, towels, blow dryer and shampoo (specifically labeled)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Signal Mountain Lodge really suits Grand Teton National Park. It's set on stunning Jackson Lake at the base of Signal Mountain and the accommodations are made of natural materials (some are log cabins) scattered among the trees. We appreciated the comfortable beds, nice staff, casual atmosphere, and amenities such as in-room refrigerator and microwave plus access to a laundry, internet and TV in the reception area.
reviews.title: Great setting, laid-back vibe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I visited the Tetons off-season, and this was the only affordable in-park lodge still open. It was a basic motel room; clean, warm, and very satisfactory, with a good restaurant within a few minutes walk. No television or luxurious decor - but who needs that when you are a 30-second walk from the lake??
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at a two-room cabin for one night in early Sept. It was the only room available when I made a reservation which cost $186. The staff was very friendly. However, the room was just too rustic for us. And it was not clean, not well maintained, and the hotel ground was just an old run down place, totally not worth the money I paid. We also didn't like their dining places. For almost the same room rate, I should have stayed at the Jackson Lake Lodge which at least has a gorgeous lobby and awesome mountain view.
reviews.title: old run down place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008
reviews.text: The cabin (1-2 person) we stayed in was rustic, basic and small but the heating worked well and they're in a great location. It was cute with a little deck to sit out on. In the evening we walked (couple of mins) to the lake to watch sunset then ate in the Trapper Grill which was superb. Great choice and very reasonable with the most amazing view through huge windows. Reception staff in the main hotel were helpful and friendly and they serve great coffee in the mornings that you can help yourself to! I was worried about mice in the cabin from a previous post but we didn't have a kitchen area and had no problems - that I noticed anyway! I'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved the location of these rustic little cabins

likes.liked: — the location and the trapper grill being within walking distance with great lake views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Signal Mountain Lodge after coming out of Yellowstone. The lodge is very well located In Grand Teton NP and a real pleasure after the indifferent service and poor food in Yellowstone. We should have cut Yellowstone short and stayed longer in Teton. We ate at both the Trapper Grill and the Peaks restaurants and enjoyed them both. After the dismal dinners in Yellowstone we felt that we had been saved. Will definitely go back.
reviews.title: Wish we had longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful stay, nice cabin , rustic but comfortable beds, We had a refrigerator. Wonderful acoomodating staff. We ate at the Grill one nif=ght and the other at the Peaks. Both dinners were very good. Had breakfast we purchased at the store on our porch. A bit cool but very nice. They had great coffee in the reception area in the morning. The view was tops.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cabins at Signal Mountain Lodge are "of a certain vintage," some rustic, some `70s-ish. This is the second year in a row we've stayed, once in a rustic cabin (sitting room & bedroom) and once in a country cabin (large single room with sitting area and fireplace). The staff in the lodging registration building is very accommodating, there's wireless internet and exceedingly good coffee. But in the individual cabins, the blinds have a season's worth of dust on them and it appears that no one has run a cloth around the faucets for some time. Pieces of thread and stray foliage that came in on shoes remained on the bathroom floor for the entire stay. On the other hand, the staff in the restaurant hustles! The Trapper Grill has good food at reasonable prices with excellent service. This is not meant to be a negative review ... it's just that the housekeeping staff could be a bit more attentive to detail, given the price of the accommodations.
reviews.title: Terrific location; indifferent housekeeping

likes.liked: — location -- easy to get to all sites aroung national park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a perfect place to stay while visiting the Grand Tetons; we stayed in a one room cabin with a king bed, full bathroom and mini-kitchen: refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. Our cabin overlooked the lake and parking was easy. We enjoyed eating an early dinner at the Trapper Inn before driving to see some wildlife.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very nice cabin at Signal Mountain Lodge. A 2 room with a front porch and a back porch and a little bit of a view of the lake. Loved the log cabin feel, it was comfortable and cozy. We had lots of room and it was very clean. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here. Enjoyed sitting on the front porch and really enjoyed the woodsy feel all around us, yet with a water view.
reviews.title: Cabin in the woods, enjoyed our stay

likes.liked: — Location of our cabns, lots of trees, a woodsy feel, view of the lake
likes.disliked: — What's not to like? It was fine, we enjoyed it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The beds are very high off of the ground. This might be a concern for famiies with small children. If they rolled off...ouch! Maybe a sleeping bag for the floor would be a good idea for little ones.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the Lakefront Retreats, which was literally on the shores of Jackson Lake. The room was very spacious with two queen beds in the bedroom. Large bathroom, kitchen area and living room. We weren't in the room much because we were out exploring the park and surrounding area. I think any of the the room options would be acceptable to most people. The entire resort sits right on the shores of Jackson Lake. We also took the Float Trip on the Snake River, which was a beautiful way to spend a morning.
reviews.title: If you want to stay on the shore of Jackson Lake.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cabin was extremely clean!! The views were unbelievable and the accomadations were well above average. Looking forward to staying there again.
reviews.title: Fantastic facility!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Really loved this cabin! Front and back porch, huge room, beautiful inside. Log cabin buildings, very clean, extremely large, surprisingly comfortable. Included several chairs, couch, two large beds, front and back porch, bathroom. Log cabin interior as well. Absolutely loved staying here! Only compalint was unrenovated bathroom...small and old, although spotless. Would always recommend!
reviews.title: Best Stay Ever!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed with extended family at this resort for 2 weeks in August. I had the 1 room bungalow. It really is a wonderful setting. The bungalows are the only rooms to have picnic tables and a large deck available. The one room has extremely limited kitchen facilities, but you can make do. The rooms are showing wear, but that isn't unexpected for the location and price. They were clean and comfortable. The setting is fabulous, the food at the restaurant is quite tasty with an extensive menu that was able to serve all the allergies and vegetarian needs of our family.
reviews.title: A very nice family vacation spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are staying with family I would recommend renting both bungalows. They share a deck and it is completely private and removed from all the other rooms. The two room bungalow has a big refrig. and a 4 burner stove, making cooking and eating there easy and most enjoyable. It does have a view of the lake and the mountains across. The lodge says "non view" but that just means no immediate view of the Grand Teton Mt. not "no view" as one would normally think of it. The bungalows are very close to the beach and so children could quickly walk down and play or swim. Probably the closest of the rooms to the beach area.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay! Beautiful view!
